title: Mostarda
body: Two crucifers are known by this name in Madeira: *Brassica Sinapistrum* and *B. nigra*. It is the latter species that produces the seeds with which mustard plasters are prepared. B. nigra has siliques with 1-nerved valves: B. Sinapistrum has them with 3-5 nerved valves. Both of these species are spontaneous and frequent in Madeira. The mustard used as a condiment is mainly supplied by the species Sinapis alba, a very rare species in Madeira.
